required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of MCLA-128 in Patients With Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Study of MCLA-128, a Full Length IgG1 Bispecific Antibody Targeting HER2 and HER3, in Patients With Solid Tumors

collaborator.agency: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase I/II, open-label, multi-center, multi-national, dose escalation, single agent study to assess the safety, tolerability, PK, PD, immunogenicity and anti-tumor activity of MCLA-128

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of number of participants with treatment related toxicities observed during the dose escalation.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Treatment-Related Adverse Events (AE)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of number of participants with abnormal laboratory values and/or AE that are related to treatment as assessed by CTCAE version 4.03

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment Related AE [safety and tolerability]
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of Treatment Related AEs or SAEs
Maximum plasma concentration [Cmax] as measured from all individual plasma concentrations

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of distribution at steady state [Vss]
secondary_outcome.description: volume of distribution at steady state [Vss]

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration versus time curve from time zero to time t [AUC0-t]
secondary_outcome.description: area under the concentration versus time curve from time zero to time t [AUC0-t]

secondary_outcome.measure: area under the concentration versus time curve [AUC0-∞]
secondary_outcome.description: area under the concentration versus time curve [AUC0-∞]

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of anti-drug antibodies against MCLA-128
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with anti-drug antibodies against MCLA-128
serum titers of anti-drug antibodies against MCLA-128

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-tumor response of MCLA-128 by RECIST v1.1
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-tumor response as measured by RECIST v1.1
CBR assessed as the proportion of patients in whom a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) is observed (where SD duration is a minimum of 12 weeks) by RECIST v1.1 .
Evaluation of clinical benefit assessed by RECIST v1.1 determining objective overall response rate (ORR)
Evaluation of clinical benefit assessed by RECIST v1.1 determining duration of response (DOR)
Evaluation of clinical benefit assessed by RECIST v1.1 determining objective progression-free survival (PFS) and/or survival

arm_group.description: Cohorts receiving escalating doses of MCLA-128 until MTD or RP2D is reached. Each Cycle is 21 days. Single agent treatment.
Participants will receive intravenous infusion of MCLA-128 at the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) once per cycle. The duration of each treatment cycle is 21 days.
Participants will receive intravenous infusion of MCLA-128 at the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) once per cycle. The duration of each treatment cycle is 21 days.
Participants will receive intravenous infusion of MCLA-128 at the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) once per cycle. The duration of each treatment cycle is 21 days.
Participants will receive intravenous infusion of MCLA-128 at the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) once per cycle. The duration of each treatment cycle is 21 days.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 2 non small cell lung cancer
arm_group.description: Participants will receive intravenous infusion of MCLA-128 at the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) once per cycle. The duration of each treatment cycle is 21 days.

intervention.description: full length IgG1 bispecific antibody targeting HER2 and HER3
intervention.arm_group_label: Part 2 non small cell lung cancer

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data are made available only to the individual patient upon specific request of that individual patient or its treating physician
